constitution_rules.title: Prioritize Determinism Over Speed
constitution_rules.description: Reproducible test runs are superior to fast but flaky runs.
requirements: Configure test frameworks to prioritize reproducible outcomes over execution speed.

constitution_rules.title: Eliminate Test-Result Caching
constitution_rules.description: Disable or purge all framework caches before every run.
requirements: Treat cached test discovery or compiled output as defect sources.

constitution_rules.title: Enforce Hermetic Test Runs
constitution_rules.description: Tests must not access network, system clocks, global OS state, or previous runs.
requirements: All tests operate in complete isolation without external dependencies.

constitution_rules.title: Maintain Test Independence
constitution_rules.description: Tests must pass when run alone or in any sequence.
requirements: Each test must be completely self-contained without shared state.

constitution_rules.title: Maintain Standard Repository Structure
constitution_rules.description: Use src/, tests/ with subdirectories unit/, component/, integration/, fixtures/, helpers/.
requirements: Adhere to standardized directory hierarchy with clear separation.

constitution_rules.title: Use Standard Test Naming Conventions
constitution_rules.description: Python: test_*.py or *_test.py; TypeScript/JavaScript: *.test.(ts|js) or *.spec.(ts|js).
requirements: Follow established naming patterns for automatic test discovery.

constitution_rules.title: Purge Cache Directories Pre-Execution
constitution_rules.description: Delete Python, Node.js, and tooling caches before test execution.
requirements: Remove all designated cache directories before test execution begins.

constitution_rules.title: Disable Framework Caching
constitution_rules.description: Use framework-specific flags to disable caching mechanisms.
requirements: Configure pytest, Jest, Vitest, Mocha with explicit cache-disabling flags.

constitution_rules.title: Maintain Unit Test Purity
constitution_rules.description: Unit tests must be pure functions with no I/O, network, or time dependencies.
requirements: Unit tests operate without external dependencies, network calls, or time-based behavior.

constitution_rules.title: Use Table-Driven Test Structure
constitution_rules.description: Unit tests must use table-driven tests for clarity.
requirements: Employ table-driven patterns with test cases in structured data format.

constitution_rules.title: Use In-Memory Doubles for Component Tests
constitution_rules.description: Component tests must use in-memory doubles only for cross-module interactions.
requirements: Employ in-memory test doubles (mocks, stubs, fakes) avoiding real external systems.

constitution_rules.title: Use Real Adapters for Integration Tests
constitution_rules.description: Integration tests must use real adapters with isolated instances.
requirements: Employ real adapters and drivers with in-process instances or containerized dependencies.

constitution_rules.title: Prohibit Internet Access in Tests
constitution_rules.description: No calls to public Internet in unit, component, or integration tests.
requirements: Tests must not make calls to public Internet services or external APIs.

constitution_rules.title: Control Randomness and Time
constitution_rules.description: All randomness must be seeded; time must be frozen or explicitly controlled.
requirements: Use TEST_RANDOM_SEED for randomness and time-freezing helpers for temporal behavior.

constitution_rules.title: Prohibit Test Retries
constitution_rules.description: Flaky tests are bugs; do not mask with retries.
requirements: Test frameworks must not employ automatic retry mechanisms.

constitution_rules.title: Organize Fixtures and Data
constitution_rules.description: Fixtures under tests/fixtures/, read-only, prefer synthetic data, hash large fixtures.
requirements: Locate fixtures in designated directory, use read-only access, prefer synthetic data, record hashes for large fixtures.

constitution_rules.title: Generate Test Evidence
constitution_rules.description: Emit jUnit XML reports and run manifest with seeds, versions, and hashes.
requirements: Produce standardized machine-readable output artifacts for each test execution.

constitution_rules.title: Design AI-Generated Tests Deterministically
constitution_rules.description: Assume cache purging, use TEST_RANDOM_SEED, compose hermetic tests.
requirements: AI-generated tests must be deterministic, hermetic, and cache-independent.

constitution_rules.title: Organize AI-Generated Tests Properly
constitution_rules.description: Place tests in correct directories, use pure helpers, minimize dependencies.
requirements: Follow directory structure, create pure helper functions, prefer standard libraries.

constitution_rules.title: Ensure AI-Generated Test Quality
constitution_rules.description: Limit test scope, provide complete implementations, create actionable failures.
requirements: Tests must be focused, complete, runnable, and have clear failure messages.

constitution_rules.title: Enforce Quality Gates
constitution_rules.description: All tests must pass, no network access, valid artifacts, cache elimination verified.
requirements: Test runs succeed only when meeting all quality criteria.

constitution_rules.title: Conduct Comprehensive Test Reviews
constitution_rules.description: Verify determinism, completeness, organization, harness usage, artifacts, cache elimination.
requirements: Code reviews must validate all test quality aspects before approval.
